response.answer_text: Any app or computer program that serves an educational purpose falls under the category of educational software. It’s a broad term, so it’s best to explain it through its practical implementation via showing the examples of educational software. Here are a few examples of educational software that both teachers and students can enjoy using: Wokabulary - This is an app for creating and using flashcards for language learning. Flashcards have always been an essential part of foreign language education. Now, they are available in a digital form. Wokabulary is one of the most effective apps for digital flashcards.Quizlet - Tests and quizzes are no longer intimidating. Thanks to Quizlet, teachers can make them fun and students can finally enjoy the knowledge evaluation process.Duolingo - When language learning apps first appeared, people were skeptical about them. But Duolingo proved to everyone that a language can be taught and learnt through an app.Studies - This is a general learning app, which works for music, math, literature, law, history, art, and any other subject. Students and teachers use it to create study notes, flashcards, and learning schedules.XMind - Mind mapping helps with the brainstorming and planning stages of each academic writing project. This is the best app to use for that purpose.
Educational software is computer software, the primary purpose of which is teaching or self-learning.Educational software
